definition: a slight blemish

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: Even though these are trivial problems, there is a great necessity to make a distinction.
sentences.chinese: 這些問題儘管是白璧微瑕，但也有辨析的必要。

definition: lit. a blemish does not obscure jade's luster/the pros outweigh the cons (idiom)
great despite minor blemishes/a rough diamond
impeccable moral integrity
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to transform gold into base metal (idiom); fig. to edit sb else's beautiful prose and ruin it
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
error in a text/text corruption
to demand perfection (idiom)
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
indisputable statement/unalterable truth
to be ridiculous/to make a fool of oneself
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes
